While Zeraora is Electric's go-to physical attacker, it still does face competition from the likes of Thundurus, which can very effectively remove conventional Zeraora checks such as Mega Venusaur and is overall very effective in the Poison matchup. To fill a similar role, Zeraora can also use a Flyinium Z set in order to remove Mega Venusaur and other bulky Grass-types, although that set lacks immediate power compared to its Choice Band sets. Zeraora's pure Electric typing leaves much to be desired, as it doesn't offer any unique beneficial secondary typing and leaves it very reliant on Plasma Fists as its strongest attack, except against foes weak to its coverage moves. Furthermore, its mediocre bulk means that it cannot easily switch into oncoming attacks except from Pokemon that do not threaten it at all, as it needs to remain healthy throughout the battle to continuously wallbreak.
Zeraora.comments:
Other Options

Electric

Outrage is a niche move that enables Zeraora to be more effective in the difficult Dragon matchup, most notably being able to outspeed and OHKO Mega Latias, an otherwise difficult Pokemon for Electric to handle, after prior chip damage. However, outside of this matchup, it seldom finds much use, and is setup bait for Dragon teams with Mega Altaria.

Checks and Counters

Electric

Electric-immune Pokemon: As Zeraora is reliant on using its STAB move, Plasma Fists, under Electric Terrain to blast past foes, Electric-immune Pokemon such as Diggersby and Excadrill prevent Zeraora from being effective as a wallbreaker and force it to rely on its coverage moves to tackle them.

Dragon- and Grass-types: Zeraora finds little use against both Dragon- and Grass-types, as they resist its primary STAB attack. Although certain Pokemon like Hydreigon and Ferrothorn are threatened by Zeraora's typical coverage, it has difficulty dealing with Pokemon such as Garchomp and Mega Venusaur.

Revenge Killers: Although Zeraora has blazing high Speed, faster Pokemon like Mega Aerodactyl and most Choice Scarf Pokemon, including Victini and Excadrill, threaten Zeraora, forcing it out of the field.

Burns: As a physical wallbreaker, Zeraora is completely inhibited by burns, which prevent it from working as a wallbreaker at all. As such, it should avoid switching into Scald and should be wary of Will-O-Wisp.

Protect: As a Choice-locked attacker, Zeraora is prone to being scouted by opposing Protect users like Toxapex and Celesteela. This enables the opponent to freely switch out to a teammate that can take on whatever move Zeraora has chosen.

Physically Defensive Walls: Physically defensive walls such as Gliscor and Mew can take Zeraora's unboosted attacks comfortably and can force it out.

Choice Band.description:
Moves

Plasma Fists is Zeraora's most powerful physical STAB attack, dealing huge damage to foes especially under Electric Terrain. Close Combat is extremely handy coverage for Zeraora, allowing it to take on bulky Normal- and Steel-types like Porygon2 and Ferrothorn. Knock Off most importantly hits Psychic-types like Latios for big damage while also providing utility by removing items such as Eviolite and Choice Scarf. Iron Tail ensures Zeraora is effective against Fairy-types, most notably outspeeding and OHKOing Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu after minor chip while also helping with Mega Altaria; however, be wary of its low accuracy, only using it when completely necessary.

Set Details

Maximum Attack and Speed investment with a Jolly nature ensures that Zeraora is as strong as possible while still outspeeding fast and threatening Pokemon like Mega Lopunny and Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu. Volt Absorb is Zeraora's only ability, which can come in handy with Plasma Fists's secondary effect and also prevents foes like Zapdos from using Volt Switch to gain momentum. Choice Band boosts Zeraora's Attack, which enables it to gain notable 2HKOs such as against Porygon2.

Usage Tips

As a physical wallbreaker, Zeraora is best used to continuously come in throughout the battle to force switches and deal huge blows while under Electric Terrain. Be sure to remove common Electric-immune Pokemon from the opponent's team such as Excadrill, Swampert, and Gliscor as soon as possible so that Zeraora can take full advantage of its powerful Plasma Fists in Electric Terrain. As Zeraora is the most vital Pokemon in the Normal matchup, use it sparingly to deal huge blows with Close Combat and take advantage of Knock Off to remove Eviolite from Chansey and Porygon2 to further aid its teammates in case it is unable to overcome the opponent alone. Take advantage of partners with a slow pivoting move such as Rotom-W and Zapdos to safely bring in Zeraora throughout the battle, giving Zeraora opportunities to wallbreak. Furthermore, avoid switching Zeraora directly into oncoming attacks, as it needs to remain healthy throughout the battle to be effective. In matchups where Zeraora is of little use such as Poison and Ground, try to take advantage of the utility of Knock Off as much as possible to attempt to disrupt the opposing team's item usage. Be wary of the defense drops that accompany Close Combat, as Zeraora will take huge blows following its use, leaving it easily checked, especially by Pokemon with priority such as Breloom and Dragonite. Considering Zeraora is a Choice-locked attacker, try to think ahead when choosing what move to use. An inappropriate choice can allow a foe to freely switch into Zeraora and can even allow a foe to punish Zeraora by using a setup move. Avoid burns at all costs, as they hinder Zeraora's physical prowess, inhibiting its function as a wallbreaker.

Team Options

As the vast majority of Electric-types are special attackers, they all vastly appreciate Zeraora's function as a physical wallbreaker to remove specially defensive walls such as Chansey. Air Balloon Alolan Golem is an excellent partner, as it serves the double purpose of both a Stealth Rock setter, slowly chipping down foes for Zeraora, and a trapper, notably trapping and removing Choice Scarf Excadrill for Zeraora. Tapu Koko is a very important Pokemon for every Electric team due to its ability to set Electric Terrain upon switching in, which further boosts Zeraora's Plasma Fists, making it an even more potent wallbreaker. It also serves very well in the Dragon matchup, where, with Zeraora, it can take down Pokemon that otherwise wall most Electric-types. Alolan Raichu is another great partner for Zeraora as a special sweeper that greatly appreciates Zeraora's ability to remove special walls. In addition, Alolan Raichu can check Pokemon faster than Zeraora, including Mega Aerodactyl and Choice Scarf Excadrill, while under Electric Terrain. Additionally, Alolan Raichu can take on Poison-types that Zeraora can't do much against such as Mega Venusaur and Nidoking. Rotom-W and Zapdos are both amazing defensive partners that together help deal with Electric-immune Pokemon that Zeraora has difficulty with such as Hippowdon and Landorus. In addition, they can remove entry hazards from the field, act as slow pivots, and neuter foes with status. Rotom-W in particular can also take on Ground-types that Zeraora is unable to deal with such as Gliscor and Hippowdon. Thundurus can be another effective teammate in helping deal with the troublesome Normal matchup by providing additional Knock Off support and Fighting-type coverage. Additionally, Thundurus can help deal with Mega Venusaur with a Supersonic Skystrike set for Zeraora to effectively rip through the remainder of Poison-type teams.

Flyinium Z.description:
Moves

Plasma Fists is Zeraora's strongest Electric-type STAB move, which allows it to heavily damage any foe that doesn't resist it under Electric Terrain. Bounce is used in tandem with Flyinium Z in order to lure and take out problematic Grass-types such as Mega Venusaur and Tapu Bulu. Close Combat is used as a solid coverage move that threatens various threats to Electric teams like Chansey and Ferrothorn. Bulk Up boosts Zeraora's physical capabilities to greater heights.

Set Details

Maximum Attack and Speed investment coupled with a Jolly nature allows Zeraora to hit as hard and as fast as possible, all while outspeeding incredibly fast foes such as Mega Lopunny and Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu. Flyinium Z is used in combination with Bounce in order to unleash Supersonic Skystrike. Volt Absorb gives Zeraora an immunity to Electric-type moves and can be useful for deterring Volt Switch pivoting.

Usage Tips

Zeraora can also be used as a late-game sweeper, as its incredible Speed stat enables it to outspeed nearly the entirety of the unboosted metagame, as well as slower boosted foes such as Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu and Mega Tyranitar after a Dragon Dance boost. Zeraora should keep in mind when to reveal Bulk Up, as utilizing the move alerts the opponent that Zeraora is the Z-Crystal user on the team. It should also avoid switching directly into attacks, as it must be kept as healthy as possible in order to effectively break down and sweep teams. Utilize the pivoting created from teammates such as Rotom-W and Tapu Koko to put Zeraora into favorable positions and gain momentum. Avoid burns from Will-O-Wisp users such as Mew, as they will heavily hamper Zeraora's damage output.

Team Options

Tapu Koko provides Zeraora with a means of checking threatening Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Mega Latias. It also provides Electric Terrain support that would slightly boost the power of Zeraora's Plasma Fists and can utilize Volt Switch in order to put it in favorable positions. Zapdos assists Zeraora with a critical Ground immunity that helps against foes such as Excadrill and Landorus while also providing utility functions that include Volt Switch to bring Zeraora into favorable postitions and Defog to remove entry hazards. Rotom-W provides another key Ground immunity for Zeraora, being able to check Ground-types such as Gliscor and Hippowdon through Hydro Pump as well as cripple physical checks such as Mega Gallade and Swampert through Will-O-Wisp. Additionally, it can use Volt Switch to keep up offensive pressure against the opponent and bring Zeraora in safely. Alolan Raichu can support Zeraora by threatening faster foes such as Mega Aerodactyl and Choice Scarf Greninja under Electric Terrain, while also checking more of the foes that Zeraora is meant to break down, such as Nidoking and Mega Venusaur. Alolan Golem provides utility for Zeraora as a Stealth Rock user that is also able to trap certain checks such as Excadrill when holding an Air Balloon.
